Title.evidence: antibiotics after an aPPendectomy In Complex appendicitis trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Patients with complex appendicitis (age ≥ 8 years) were randomly allocated to 2 days or 5 days of intravenous antibiotics after appendectomy.

Participants.evidence: Patients with complex appendicitis (age ≥ 8 years) were randomly allocated to 2 days or 5 days of intravenous antibiotics after appendectomy. Patient inclusion lasted from June 2017 to June 2021 in 15 Dutch hospitals.

Intervention.evidence: Patients with complex appendicitis (age ≥ 8 years) were randomly allocated to 2 days or 5 days of intravenous antibiotics after appendectomy.

Objective.evidence: To compare costs for 2 days versus 5 days of postoperative antibiotics within the antibiotics after an aPPendectomy In Complex appendicitis trial.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary trial endpoint was a composite endpoint of infectious complications and mortality within 90 days.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Patients with complex appendicitis (age ≥ 8 years) were randomly allocated to 2 days or 5 days of intravenous antibiotics after appendectomy.

Blinding.evidence: This was a pragmatic, open-label, multicenter clinical trial powered for noninferiority.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Patient inclusion lasted from June 2017 to June 2021 in 15 Dutch hospitals.

Number_Analysed.evidence: In total, 1005 patients were evaluated in the “intention-to-treat” analysis: 502 patients were allocated to the 2-day group and 503 to the 5-day group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The mean difference in overall societal costs was – €625 (95% CI: –€ 958 to –€ 278) to the advantage of the 2-day group.
